abstract: The Southern African Customs Union (SACU) is the most unequal region in the world. While there has been some progress in recent years, inequality has remained almost stagnant in the most unequal countries. Using an innovative framework, this report provides a systematic and comprehensive analysis of inequality in the region.
authors: Victor Sulla, Precious Zikhali, and Pablo Facundo Cuevas
alt: Cover of the report Inequality in Southern Africa: An Assessment of the Southern African Customs Union. The cover shows a map of the world behind a scale or balance. The flags of Namibia, South Africa, Lesotho, Botswana, and Eswatini are superimposed over those countries on the map.
shorttitle: Inequality in Southern Africa : An Assessment of the Southern African Customs Union
